Articles.Content:
This thread will be short.

All it is saying is that there is an Orion test tomorrow at 10H30(AM) and you can watch it live here:

https://plus.google.com/events/c8o3eh2udaosuknsrd8cj8s0l7c

The capsule will be dropped from a plane at 35,000 feet to evaluate its parachutes,let's hope that jeb don't get in the way at the wrong moment!

One of the three main parachute will undergo a failure.

The question is:can we call that a failure if the "failure" is desired?
I'm gonna be at school and my teachers don't care about space exploration.

Don't worry,I'm sure the video will be posted on youtube not long after the test.

Of course,it won't be live but that's better than nothing :-/
